summary:
<think>
Okay, I need to summarize this document about J. Thomas Hill in 3-5 sentences. Let me read through the content again.

The document starts by introducing James Thomas Hill as an American businessman and CEO of Vulcan Materials Company. His early life mentions he was born around 1959 and graduated from the University of Pittsburgh. His career includes working at Vulcan from 1979-1990, then Redlands Stone Products from 1990-1996, and returning to Vulcan in 1996. He became CEO in 2014 after Donald M. James. He's also on the U.S. Chamber of Commerce board.

The main topic is his professional background and roles. Key points are his education, career progression, leadership at Vulcan, and board membership. I should focus on his role as CEO, his career timeline, and his current positions. Need to make sure it's concise, avoiding minor details like exact dates unless they're crucial. Also, check if "J. Thomas Hill" and "James Thomas Hill" are the same person, which they are. Make sure to mention his birth year, education, companies he worked for, and his current positions. Keep it to 3-5 sentences without unnecessary info.
</think>

J. Thomas Hill, born around 1959, is an American businessman and CEO of Vulcan Materials Company. He graduated from the University of Pittsburgh and built his career at Vulcan Materials, working there from 1979 to 1990 and returning in 1996 after a stint at Redlands Stone Products. Hill became CEO in 2014, succeeding Donald M. James, and also serves on the U.S. Chamber of Commerce's board of directors. His professional trajectory highlights his long-term leadership role in the materials industry and his involvement in broader business advocacy.

# J. [S3] Thomas Hill



**James Thomas Hill** (born c. [S4] 1959) is an American businessman. [S5] He is the chief executive officer of Vulcan Materials Company. [S6] ## Early life

Hill was born circa 1959. [S7] He graduated from the University of Pittsburgh. [S8] ## Career

Hill worked for the Vulcan Materials Company from 1979 to 1990, and Redlands Stone Products from 1990 to 1996. [S9] He returned to Vulcan Materials in 1996. [S10] He succeeded Donald M. [S11] James as its chief executive officer and president in July 2014. [S12] Hill serves on the board of directors of the U.S. [S13] Chamber of Commerce.

[S4] 1959 is in the first part. Then [S7] says "Hill was born circa 1959." So both sentences [S4] and [S7] are relevant. Therefore, the answer is 1959 with citations [S4][S7].
